Description: Rectangular limestone window-grille; double cornice with two winged sun-discs in relief at the top; crowned uraei on lotus and papyrus plants at either side; bars in the form of Hathor-head columns; repaired from two fragments.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Said to be from Dendera.
Curator's comments: Published: PM VI, p.75. Cleopatra's Egypt, Brooklyn 1988, p. 88-89 [5] = Kleopatra, Mainz 1989, p. 91 [4]. Des Dieux, des tombeaux, un savant. En Egypte sur les pas de Mariette Pacha (Boulogne catalogue 2004), 204-5.
Bibliographic references: Brooklyn 1988 / Cleopatra's Egypt: Age of the Ptolemies (no. 5)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2004 7 May-30 Aug, Boulogne, Château-Musée, Des dieux, des tombeaux, unsavant: En Egypt sur les pas de Mariette Pacha
